bullets.text: Oversees technical strategy and execution for US Health division, leading development, product, support, application engineering, and engineering management teams.
Responsible for overall prioritization and resourcing decisions, from multi-year technical vision to quarterly roadmaps to sprint by sprint resource allocations.
Writes product design documents and technical specifications for key features. Directly implements and reviews critical features when needed.
Directly coordinates the teamâ€™s high priority efforts when required around escalated technical issues and incident response.
Liaises with service implementaation team, balancing business requirements and timelines with platform stability and technical sustainability.

bullets: Second-most prolific contributor to commcare-hq, one of GitHub's 100 most valuable open source projects*
Contributor to multiple technology stacks: Django, Java server, Android, and Node
Led JavaScript modernization initiative in 10-year-old, 100K-line codebase

bullets.text: Lead engineer in US Health, Mission, and Software as a Service divisions at various times

bullets: Schweers, J. & Deflaux, G. "Design Sprints: Inspiring big changes in digital solutions." Presentation at 10th ICT4D Conference, Lusaka, Zambia, 2018.

Schweers, J., Khalid, M., Underwood, H., Bishnoi, S., & Chhugani, M. "mLabour: Design and Evaluation of a Mobile Partograph and Labour Ward Management Application." Paper presented at Humanitarian Technology 2016: Science, Systems, and Global Impact, Boston, MA.

bullets.text: Acted as tech lead for two cross-functional teams and managed three developers
Worked on redesign and re-implementation of core clinical experience
Developed workflows to facilitate physician productivity and support client compliance with federal Meaningful Use standards
Developed features for StepGreen.org, a website that encourages sustainable living
Developed and maintained components of eBay's core ad optimization platform, which manages $250 million annually in marketing spend
Architected system to move long-running processes offline, drastically reducing load times and browser crashes
Twice recognized as a top performer within 200-person department
Schweers, Jennifer. (2023). "The Next Step: Current Sexual Lifestyles and Future Intentions." Socius, 9. https://doi.org/10.1177/23780231231188335
Harvard Extension School, graduate coursework in psychology, spring & summer 2021
